title: Does not open anymore
text: One day Teams just stopped opening on my iPhone. I have tried every troubleshooting step known to man and IT is involved. I use this app for work and now I cannot access it on my iPhone. Please fix this bug!

title: Current Time on Calendar
text: I love many things about this app! Unfortunately, one of the things I hate is a real problem for a power user in Teams. When looking at the calendar view, the line indicating the current time is constantly several hours off. For instance, when I‚Äôm looking at teams at 3:45 in the afternoon the current timeline indicates it‚Äôs 7:45 in the morning. It is constantly offset and really a useless tool in the situation. I have tried deleting the app and adding it back to my phone with the same result. I know other people with the exact same problem using a different iPhone model than myself. Please look into this and correct this on your next update.

title: Notifications showing nothing

title: Notifications are Wonky
text: I've noticed since the last update that the notifications are not removed from my phone when I read a message from my computer.  Not only does the badge notification remain, but it's also compounded after I open the message from my phone.  If it shows 2 unread messages, and I open from my phone so the badge goes away, the next time I get a single message, the badge will have a 3.  It's really annoying because it misrepresents the number of unread messages I have.  This update is terrible!!

title: No longer get notifications
text: Everything was working fine until the most recent update and now I no longer get notifications.

title: Needs to be deleted and reinstalled frequently
text:
I‚Äôve got complaints about the design of MS Teams on all platforms, but the iOS application in particular needs to be deleted and reinstalled frequently. It will often just stop displaying anything other than a fully blank screen. When this happens, force quitting MS Teams or rebooting the iPad does not fix the problem. MS Teams shows the same blank white screen after a force quit or full power cycle of the iPad.

Deleting the MS Teams app and reinstalling it from the App Store has consistently gotten it working again. My guess is that Teams somehow corrupts its local storage to the point that it can‚Äôt recover and only by deleting the app completely is it possible to completely remove whatever is corrupted.

title: Need to fix compatibility
text: One star review because Microsoft teams does not work with Apple CarPlay for iOS 17. Messages cannot be sent or listen to while using Apple CarPlay and Microsoft teams.

title: CarPlay doesn‚Äôt seem to work anymore
text: The app itself is okay for phone chat and calls, but up until maybe 6 or 7 months ago, it worked fine with Apple CarPlay in vehicles. Now it doesn‚Äôt work. If you tap a message on the CarPlay screen, it takes you to calendar or meetings instead of reading the message. And I was NEVER able to respond using CarPlay.

title: CarPlay Integration broken.
text: Since the most recent upgrade of iOS (17.X) the chat function no longer works in CarPlay. Many of us have been discussing this on Microsoft community forms, but Microsoft has not responded with any fix. Not having this functionality makes using chat, while driving impossible.

title: Too glitchy for the worlds biggest tech company
text: Connections are worse than a Verizon commercial - ‚Äúcan you hear me now?‚Äù  Mobile and desktop sync is atrocious - why am I notified of unread messages on 2/26/24 for meetings that ended 2/3/24 and missed called that I already returned last week?  We frequently have issues joining calls from outlook and have to call each other into the meeting.  Three years ago I would have rated it 5/5, but now it‚Äôs so glitchy and features keep moving around .

title: Bug with Bluetooth
text: There is currently a bug where if I am in a call on Bluetooth , and I switch out of Teams to view a note or document, the Bluetooth stops working suddenly and it becomes impossible to get it to connect again.

title: Teams is incredible.
text: Microsoft has done a great job of integrating all of there tools (sharepoint, teams, outlook, etc) in ways that allow you to collaborate beyond anything I have seen. I have used the other collaboration apps (Google, Zoom, Slack) and none get close to the comprehensive integration that MS has achieved.

title: Calendar redline not current time
text: I am running version 6.3.1 in iOS 17.3.1 and the calendar redline which should reflect the current time is not accurate. Multiple users have reported this issue in the Microsoft Community and after following the recommended troubleshooting steps no one has been able to resolve the issue. This appears to be a bug in the app.

title: Notifications broken
text:
The notifications badge constantly displays the incorrect number of messages I have. For example, I had 2 messages, but the app badge displays 14!

Also, the app doesn‚Äôt let you go to your Teams chat, while on a Teams call. The only chat group you can see is the one for the call. Any attempts to go to your other Teams messages doesn‚Äôt work - instead you are bounced back to the call you‚Äôre on. I need to be able to message my teammates while on a call, esp. for urgent matters. And I need to be able to reference Teams messages during my call.

title: The Teams experience made spatial. Impressive!
text:
I am not a power Teams user, so there might be features that others need that I have no insight to. So I will say, from the basic view of DMs, Team chats, and meetings then this is Teams as you know it! 
My only quibble is that I wish the ‚ÄòSend Message‚Äô button was not located right in the button corner (where it makes sense for every other platform) I think with gaze tracking I have a harder time ‚Äòfocusing‚Äô on that target and some times my eyes dart around nearby controls. It would make the day-to-day usage of the app more comfortable if the send button was made maybe a bit bigger and more central on the window. Could just be me though.

Thank you for the hard work!
